column3: qŭam admirábile èst nomen tuum in univèrsa terra
column4: qŭóniam eleváta èst magnificèntia tua super caĕlos. ^ O Lord
column6: how admirable is thy name in the whole earth
column7: for thy magnificence is elevated above the heavens.

column1: 3 ^ Ex ore infántium et lactèntium perfecìsti laŭdem pròpter inimícos tuos
column2: ut déstruas inimícum et ultórem. ^ Out of the mouth of infants and of sucklings thou hast perfected praise
column4: that thou mayst destroy the enemy and the avenger.

column3: lunam et stellas qŭaĕ tu fundavìsti. ^ For I will behold thy heavens
column5: the moon and the stars which thou hast founded.

column4: qŭóniam vísitas eum~? ^ What is man
column5: that thou art mindful of him~? Or the son of man

column1: 6 ^ Minuvìsti eum paŭlo mìnus ab ángelîs~; glória et honóre coronavìsti eum
column2: ^ Thou hast made him a little less than the angels~; thou hast crowned him with glory and honour

column1: 7 ^ et constituvìsti eum super ópera mánuum tuárum. ^ and hast set him over the works of thy hands.

column4: ^ Thou hast subjected all things under his feet
column6: moreover also the beasts of the fields

column2: et pìsces maris qŭi perámbulant sémitas maris. ^ the birds of the air
column3: and the fishes of the sea that pass through the paths of the sea.
